function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Health risks and reduced labor productivity due to social distancing measures","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inequality in income and wage distribution","category":"Social","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Technological advancements in robotics and automation may lead to increased human-job displacement, affecting the economic and social well-being of workers.","category":"Economic","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High robot density leading to increased inequality","category":"Social","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of personal protective measures","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Simplified model assumptions may not be generalizable across all settings","category":"Uncertainty","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Neglect of factors that can negatively impact the efficacy of vector control, such as insecticide resistance and improper choice of insecticide","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Neglect of seasonal fluctuation in mosquito biting habits, leading to inaccurate representations of disease transmission","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Semi-arbitrary choice of 2 days for length of time in the protected class","category":"Uncertainty","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Utilizing the parameter for distribution of susceptible individuals between protected and unprotected classes to adjust initial conditions","category":"Uncertainty","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sensitivity to parameters with semi-arbitrary values","category":"Uncertainty","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited carrying capacity for mosquito larvae in each patch","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The modified ross-macdonald model reflects the specific case of zika virus in aedes aegypti mosquitos.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Wider range of suitable habitats for mosquito populations due to climate change","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of transparency in the model-agnostic design may lead to inaccurate risk assessment.","category":"Uncertainty","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Assumptions necessary for the calibration of both the underlying crowd model and exposed","category":"Uncertainty","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Sensitivity of the exposed model to user assumptions for occupant exposure and k-multiplier","category":"Uncertainty","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Verification and validation v&v of crowd models","category":"Uncertainty","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Universal application of exposed to any pedestrian crowd models","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Retrofitting existing crowd models may lead to errors in occupant exposure assessments during pandemics.","category":"Uncertainty","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Dependence on assumptions concerning disease transmissions may lead to inaccurate occupant exposure assessments.","category":"Uncertainty","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Heavy dependence on existing crowd models and assumptions may limit the accuracy and applicability of the occupant exposure assessments.","category":"Uncertainty","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure time between 0 and 5 minutes for each individual agent to a given number of agents in the building","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Identifying the maximum number of people that agents are exposed to at the same time","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Average and standard deviations of the time of exposures to each number of people provide valuable information for quantitative risk assessment","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to contagious diseases due to contact with different numbers of agents in a built environment.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate information on maximum exposure time","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Occupant exposure in confined spaces","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Physical contact between pedestrians in confined spaces","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Occupant exposure in confined spaces based on social distance radius","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Modelling assumption based on incomplete understanding of disease transmission","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on assumptions about disease transmission mechanisms","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Retrofitting existing microscopic crowd models without considering specific disease transmission characteristics","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of representation of space usage of pedestrians at a microscopic scale in current disease-spreading models","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of comprehensive sub-models in crowd models for performing occupant exposure analysis","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to assess the impact of disease spread in confined spaces without microscopic crowd models","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on macroscopic epidemiological models","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of data to fully support spatial separation rules for disease transmission","category":"Uncertainty","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Need for flexible disease transmission models to accommodate different assumptions","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Access to software and hardware for job performance during covid-19","category":"Technology","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Possible transmission of covid-19 during the evaluation process","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate protection measures for participants during the evaluation process","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Correlation analyses used to evaluate association between quantitative variables","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Assumptions for kruskal-wallis h test may not have been met","category":"Uncertainty","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Utilizing a small sample size of 97 subjects may lead to a lack of generalizability of the findings.","category":"Uncertainty","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases in supply chains","category":"Economic","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Forced stoppage of construction projects leading to fiscal losses for both big and small construction companies","category":"Economic","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impacts of covid-19 on the supply chain system, leading to operational and disruption risks","category":"Economic","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disruption of construction projects due to epidemics","category":"Economic","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Financial losses in construction companies","category":"Economic","confidence":"High"}]}
